results.title: Super 8 soldiers
results.creator_credit: Kino Eye Pictures, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Mark Worth
results.brief_description: This unusual video explores the day-to-day life of Australian soldiers who served during the Vietnamese War. By using super-8 film footage that the soldiers took of themselves, we are taken from training in Australia to the camps in Vietnam where the young men were to confront the terrors of fighting a bitter guerrila war. The super-8 images are ultimately touching because they reveal young boys at the point of losing their innocence. The haunting musical score is by David Bridie and John Phillips of Not Drowning, Waving.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kino Eye Pictures, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Mark Worth

results.title: Sunstruck
results.creator_credit: Immigrant (AU), Jack Neary, James Grafton and James Gilbert
results.brief_description: After responding to a New South Wales government advertisement designed to attract teachers from Britain, a shy teacher from Wales is assigned to a one-teacher school in the isolated bush town of Kookaburra Springs. Initially he has problems adjusting to his new life as he struggles to gain respect from his students. Despite resistance he forms a school choir, which travels Sydney to participate in a singing competition. The trip is a success and on their return to Kookaburra Springs he decides to stay on in the town and marry. Primarily a vehicle for British singer and comedian Harry Secombe, the film was shot on location near the New South Wales town of Parkes with a budget of under $400,000. Cast also includes Maggie Fitzgibbon, John Meillon, Peter Whittle, Dawn Lake, Bobby Limb.

results.title: Sunshine romance
results.brief_description: This short romantic docudrama was made in the year after World War II and begins by showing troops returning home and what “freedom” means to them and the women waiting for them after the horrors of war. A nationalistic film, with commentary about the future Bill and his girl Sue had planned before Bill was called off to war - symbolic of a nation with a great future. Set in the scenic beauty of the Blue Mountains and the colorful hustle bustle of Sydney. Featuring John Temple and Coralie Kelly as the lovers, and commentary by Robert Pollard.

results.title: Sunshine province
results.brief_description: Presents Nelson, New Zealand’s sunshine province, settled in 1841. Shows Nelson’s sporting and tourist activities: public historical buildings, sightseeing, golfing, surf beach as well as Nelson’s agricultural industries including tobacco growing and apple orchards.

results.title: Sunshine North Technical School (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Timothy Read, Chris Noonan and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Place Where Books Are Kept”
Examines new techniques and attitudes toward the total library services in a co-educational technical school in Victoria (Sunshine North Technical School) with a large migrant student population.

results.title: Sunshine man : Changes face of farming
results.brief_description: Examines the development of the Sunshine Harvester by Hugh McKay, and the landmark industrial relations conflict in which he subsequently became involved, leading to the first Basic Wage ruling (1907).

results.title: Sunshine and shadows: seventy years of Australian cinema
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and Brian Adams
results.brief_description: Jack Thompson examines the evolution of Australian cinema from the isolated production of “The True Story of the Kelly Gang” in 1906 to the increasingly confident films of the 1970s. Seventy years of triumph, heartbreak, frustration, hopes, fears and success. With the aid of film clips, this documentary also looks at various themes and attitudes expressed in the films of this period. Written by David Stratten. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Sunshine and shadow [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Ric Burns, Lisa Ades, New York Historical Society, WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.), Thirteen, WGBH (Boston) and Steeplechase Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “New York: a documentary film”.
Episode 3: SUNSHINE AND SHADOW (1865-1898) charts New York’s history during the decades following the Civil War when it continued to grow demographically, geographically and financially at a staggering rate. It explores the incomparable fortunes of the robber barons at the unabashed corruption of political leaders in an era when the expansion of both wealth and poverty- and the schism between them- built to a complex. The episode ends with the consolidation of the five boroughs to form Greater New York on January 1, 1898. Narrated by David Ogden Stiers.
